intro: Capanea affinis, commonly known as the slender capanea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Capanea affinis typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and swampy areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
